Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER NELSON.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrew's R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y.  100007.

Council Member Nelson moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 10, 2002 be adopted and printed by Council Member Martinez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Martinez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 10, 2002 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Joel A. Miele, Sr. to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the Board of Standards and Appeals, pursuant to Section 31 and 659 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Joel A. Miele, Sr., Appointment, Board of Standards &  Appeals

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Richard W. Eaddy to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Section 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Richard W. Eaddy, Appointment, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority and the NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2003 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Certificate setting the maximum amount of debt and reserves.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  - "AN ACT to amend the county law and the New York city charter, in relation to the adjudication of violations of laws enforced by the New York city department of consumer affairs". S.7319-A/A.11201-A
Items.MatterName: Adjudication of violations of laws enforced by the NYC Dep't of Consumer Affairs (S.7319A/A.11201A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  - "AN ACT to amend the general city law, chapter 772 of the laws of 1996, relating to enabling a city having a population of one million or more to raise tax revenue, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to tax credits authorized under the relocation and employment assistance program". S.4331-A/A.8536-A
Items.MatterName: Enabling a city having a population of one million or more to raise tax revenue (S.4331A/A.8536A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  - "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed". S.6727/A.7266-A
Items.MatterName: Number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed". (S.6727/A.7266A)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County, and Borough Offices

Communication from the Public Advocate - Submitting the name of Karen Phillips to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the City Planning Commission, for a term that began on July 1, 2000, pursuant to Section 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Karen Phillips, Appointment, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2003, pursuant to Section 1519 of the City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for FY'03.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750, or vacant or unimproved land; and non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health be 18 percent (18%) for Fiscal Year 2003.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750 (18%) for FY'03.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting resolution recommending that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 or where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid by a mortgage escrow agent be eighteen percent (18%), and nine percent (9%) in all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 (18%) & (9%).

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2003 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750 or where taxes are held in escrow or where parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land, and nine percent (9%) in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'03 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750.

Items.MatterName: Provisional appointments (S.7377, A.10291)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7409, and Committee on Rules, A.11418, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to refunding certain member contributions made pursuant to chapter 96 of the laws of 1995".
Items.MatterName: Refunding certain member contributions made pursuant to chapter 96 of the laws of 1995 (S.7409, A.11418)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings to compel the Department of Housing Preservation and Development to implement building-wide code enforcement inspections when requested through tenant petitions and to implement neighborhood cyclical inspections in order to preserve the housing stock.
Items.MatterName: HPD to implement building-wide code enforcement inspections.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the State Election Law to extend the right to vote to individuals who are currently serving parole.
Items.MatterName: Amend the State Election Law, extend the right to vote to individuals who are currently serving parole.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Treasury Department to return the United States Customs Service and its 750 employees back to its historic home in lower Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: US Treasury Dep't to return the US Customs Service back to its home in Manhattan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council to approve a five-year extension of partial real property tax exemptions for Gouverneur Gardens Housing Corporation.
Items.MatterName: Approve a five-year extension of partial real property tax exemptions for Gouverneur Gardens Housing Corporation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the screening of home care services personnel by persons, corporations or other entities under contract with the city.
Items.MatterName: Screening of home care services personnel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the administrative tribunal of the taxi and limousine commission.
Items.MatterName: The administrative tribunal of the taxi and limousine commission.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to requiring the chancellor of the city school district to submit to the Council quarterly reports on the status of all school capital projects.
Items.MatterName: Quarterly report on the status of Board of Ed capital projects.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that enactment of Proposed Int. No. 14-B does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with the state environmental quality review act.
Items.MatterName: Int. No. 14-A impact on the environment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to the composition of the Veterans’ Advisory Board.
Items.MatterName: Composition of the Veterans' Advisory Board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact Senate Bill S.1329, which would amend Section 467-b of the Real Property Law to enable municipalities to grant a tax abatement to disabled veterans who are heads of households, not on public assistance, who live in rent controlled or rent stabilized dwelling units, and who would qualify for an abatement under certain income eligibility requirements.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Grant tax abatement to disabled veterans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation providing financial relief to motorists who insure their cars and further calling upon the New York State Legislature to create a Brooklyn Insurance Financial Pool to offset high insurance rates evident in the Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Financial Relief to motorists who insure their cars.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 58th anniversary of D-Day, June 6, 1944, and honoring  the heroism and valor of our veterans.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 58th anniversary of D-Day, June 6, 1944.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the preservation of records of elected officials of the city.
Items.MatterName: Preservation of records of elected officials of the city.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature and the Governor to enact legislation restoring to New York City full authority over rent regulation.
Items.MatterName: Restoring to New York City full authority over rent regulation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to invoke the spirit of the historic "Liberty Trees" by planting "Freedom Trees" in neighborhoods throughout the City to honor the memories of the men and women who died in the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center.
Items.MatterName: Planting of "Freedom Trees" for those who died in WTC 9/11

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a surcharge on wireless communications service for the purpose of funding public safety communications networks.
Items.MatterName: Surcharge on wireless communications service for the purpose of funding public safety communications networks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disallowing, for purposes of the city general corporation tax, banking corporation tax and unincorporated business income tax, certain additional accelerated depreciation deductions with respect to certain property acquired after September 10, 2001, allowed by the amendments to the internal revenue code made by section 101 of public law 107-147.
Items.MatterName: Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rate of tax on cigarettes.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for municipal park projects, local waterfront revitalization projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within the City of New York and the signing of associated state contracts under the appropriate laws of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for certain projects.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. 020236 ZSR, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Staten Island, Council District no. 51 to allow the development of a large retails establishment (Use Group 6 and 10A).  This action is subject to review and actions by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the dates of mayoral disapprovals of Council action and Council overrides thereof, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand three.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.MatterName: Extending Budget Due Date
